ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: My German-speaking ability improved immensely, as did my listening, writing, and reading. I felt much more fluent by the end of the course. I also learned a lot about sports culture in Germany.
Practice speaking, writing, and reading German.
I improved my German and learned a lot of modern and sport-based vocabulary. I strengthened my German grammar skills and continued to learn new constructions in the language.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Incredible amazing instructor! Literally take anything with Prof. Sippel and you won't regret. The class itself was very well structured and interesting, both in terms of content and its language component. 10/10
The strengths of the course are the focus on controversies in German sports and the focus on student-selected grammar topics.
Frau Sippel is fantastic and keeps all students very engaged.

It covered a lot of sports-related topics in German culture, and I definitely learned and remember a lot about the subjects taught. Although it focused on specific sports and spent more time on some sports than others, students are still given a couple opportunities to research any sports-related topics of their own interest through the creative tasks and the final paper.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The class ran very smoothly online.

The course seminar format worked well; students are supposed to engage with the class and actively speak German, and Zoom did not seem to inhibit this; breakout rooms give students a chance to work in smaller groups, which is helpful to students who may be shy about speaking in front of everyone.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, the instructor is fantastic. She cares deeply about her students and makes learning German an enjoyable experience. I received very clear feedback which improved my language skills a lot.
Yes, it's a great course to improve one's German and learn about German culture. It's a very fun course.
I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to improve their German.
Yes! Even if you are not interested in sports, there is still a lot to learn about modern German culture, and the class does not expect anyone to have knowledge of sports beforehand.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Seminar with breakout rooms, and online assignments on Canvas.
